Workforce - Health and safety [abstract]
Employees turnover rate [abstract]
Employee turnover rate
Calculation: (number of employees who left during the reporting period / average number of employees during the reporting period) * 100
Number of recordable work related accidents in the reporting period
Rate of recordable work related accidents in the reporting period

Calculation: (number of recordable work-related accidents in the reporting year / total number of hours worked in a year by all employees) * 200000. The amount of 200000 hours represents the total annual working hours of 100 employees (40 hours per week for 50 weeks per year) and serves as the standard base for calculating the incidence rate over a year, applicable to undertakings with up to 250 employees
Number of fatalities as a result of work-related injuries and work-related ill health

Country of employment contract [axis]
Number of employees for country of employment contract [abstract]
Remuneration and collective bargaining [abstract]
Employees receive pay equal or above minimum wage determined by national law or collective bargaining agreement
Percentage gap in pay between female and male employees
Calculation: ((average gross hourly pay level of male employees - average gross hourly pay level of female employees) / average gross hourly pay level of male employeees) * 100
Percentage of employees covered by collective bargaining agreements
Calculation: (number of employees covered by collective bargaining agreements / total number of employees) * 100
Number of annual training hours per employee [abstract]
Average number of annual training hours per male employee
Average number of annual training hours per female employee
Average number of annual training hours per other gender employee
Average number of annual training hours per non-reported gender employee
Female-to-male ratio at management level for the reporting period
Calculation: number of female employees at management level / number of male employees at management level

Greenhouse Gas Emissions intensity [abstract]
Location-based Scope 1 and Scope 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions intensity
The numerator is expected to be "tCO2e [utr:tCO2e]" and the denominator a currency with a unit from the iso4217 set of currencies, for example [iso4217:EUR]
Calculation: (Scope 1 + Scope 2 GHG emissions location-based) / turnover
Market-based Scope 1 and Scope 2 Greenhouse Gas Emissions intensity
The numerator is expected to be "tCO2e [utr:tCO2e]" and the denominator a currency with a unit from the iso4217 set of currencies, for example [iso4217:EUR]
Calculation: (Scope 1 + Scope 2 GHG emissions market-based) / turnover

Total (gross) location-based GHG emissions

Total (gross) market-based GHG emissions

Total location-based Greenhouse Gas Emissions intensity
The numerator is expected to be "tCO2e [utr:tCO2e]" and the denominator a currency with a unit from the iso4217 set of currencies, for example [iso4217:EUR]
Calculation: (Scope 1 + Scope 2 + Scope 3 GHG emissions location-based) / turnover
Total market-based Greenhouse Gas Emissions intensity
The numerator is expected to be "tCO2e [utr:tCO2e]" and the denominator a currency with a unit from the iso4217 set of currencies, for example [iso4217:EUR]
Calculation: (Scope 1 + Scope 2 + Scope 3 GHG emissions market-based) / turnover
